ItemOrganization¶

This folder holds scripts that dictate the state of values at run-time. Such values are the scraping client's rotation, the data structure that stores and graphs the item data, and the class that organizes the flow of events.

Client.py¶

ProductCollection.py¶

class ProductCollection.ProductCollection(csv_file, *groups)¶

Bases: object

Represents a collection of product data scraped from eBayScraper.com. Implemented with the pandas module.

add_item(title, price, date, sale_type)¶

Adds an item to the collection.

export_data(csv_file)¶

Exports data from the underlying data structure to the .csv file. Typically invoked after scraping data.

Parameters

csv_file (str) -- The file to export the data

get_count_added()¶

Returns the number of newly added items.

get_recent_date(sale_type)¶

Returns the most recent date stored in based on the sale_type.

Parameters

sale_type (str) -- either 'BIN' or 'Auction'

Return type

pandas.Timestamp or None if there are no items stored

reset_count_added()¶

Resets the counter that tracks the number of items added to storage.

scatter(png_file)¶

Creates a scatter plot that overlaps the data from all sale_type(s). Saves the plot to a .png file.
